I've had many great experiences playing this game. Obviously I wouldn't have 1000+ hours otherwise.

Sometimes you get lucky and you get teammates who are willing to save you or even sacrifice themselves for you. But far more times than not you get toxic teammates who only look after themselves, lead the chase to other teammates, or will literally watch you die and teabag you so they can escape through the hatch (accessible to the last remaining survivor). You will try your best to be a hopeful and survivor with "no one left behind," but that mentality lasts for you first 10 hours and then realize how awful the community is. You might ask: "Well Seal, why not just play with you friends?" Fantastic question.

I DON'T HAVE FRIENDS. Lol okay, that's not true. I'd say Survive With Friends (SWF) is about only thing fun about the game... for survivors. Because boy, oh boy, is it hell for a killer main. In fact 3/4 of lobbies that you enter with SWF, the killer (who is the host) will immediately end the lobby because the survivors know each other. You will notice that many plays block their profiles so the killer cannot confirm there are friends in the lobby. I have nicknamed SWF "Sit With Friends," because that's pretty much what you do for 10 minutes, just to find a lobby with 300+ ping in which a survivor is going to DC in the first 10 seconds of the game. This wait time was actually brought up to the devs, and they spewed some garbage statistic that only 3% of players experience a 5 minute wait time or more. Lol k. Buy this game and I will welcome you to the very disproportional 3%.

If you have made it this far, my guess is that you have read other reviews too. Many which mention how unbalanced the game is in favor of survivors. As a survivor main I can confirm this is true. "Seal, wouldn't that make it a more enjoyable experience then?" Lol no not really. Unfortunately survivor mains are not just toxic to their teammates. They are super toxic to the killer too. Between pallet camping/looping, OP flashlighters, and excessive teabagging (2 of the 3 are essential survival tactics), killers  have had enough. Most killers in response to unbalanced gameplay have resorted to face-camping and tunneling their hooks to secure a kill (The killer chooses one person and makes sure their gameplay experience is absolutely miserable that game). When they are done with that survivor they move onto the next, often killing 2-3 in a game. I doubt even the killers have fun doing it most of the time, but its the most efficient way to rank up for average joes. AKA, this isn't really enjoyable for either side. 

On top of all this poo, the game has so many bugs. The devs take months to resolve things that really should be easy fixes. And then they break something else while patching. Lather. Rinse. Repeat. And I hate to sing along to the DBD broken record, but they just keep pumping out new DLC instead of sitting down and fixing their makeshift product. 

Look I could probably complain about this all day, so for the TLDNR students in the back of the classroom:

If you like waiting 10 minutes to play with turds for teammates, all for a mediocre gameplay experience. This might be a game for you. Otherwise, you might want to save yourself the time and money to play a more enjoyable game.

Look, this is a good game, but if you are relying on feedback from other users you should probably not purchase until you take the time to see some gameplay videos, understand what you're getting yourself into a bit better.
The hit game Dead by Daylight is not for most people and can be very triggering.

So let's have a brief rant! :)
This game has the dumbest matchmaking system in the universe (MMR). Before it still had the dumbest matchmaking system in the universe (and then they made it worse). :tada: yaaay.
It punishes success in a weird way as you progress.
In part, this has made the community more and more toxic, gamers more competitive.
This way, having fun is getting harder but there are still nuggets of joy to be had.

Now, what's good about the game? Well, when its not broken*, its incredibly fun, it can be balanced and you will get great thrills.

*game patches will on occasion mess stuff up.

Let me just edit this whole damn review. Why? Because there's actually only a few minor, nitpicky problems I have. Besides one LARGE problem. The community is full of troglodytes. Usually, people who derank so they can bully new people. Don't let this dissuade. This game is pretty good. For it's price, it's a pretty good game. You get a lot of fun out of it, and you can meet some damn cool people in it. Sometimes, they'll be toxic. Don't let it get to you. I usually laugh it off unless it's the trogs who derank. Mainly because, four people with flashlights is absolutely hilarious. And, sometimes I ragey killer is funny. Sometimes a toxic survivor is funny. Don't take it too seriously, and HAVE FUN. That's the biggest thing with this. Have fun. The majority of the community is cool. So, get it, see if you like it. I hope you do, and if you don't, go look at my other positively reviewed games. See if there's one you like.
